reviewText: Bad acting. Bad writing. Great costumes and sets.

Happened to catch this on TV. It is so bad I thought it was a comedy. Truly one of the worst TV movies ever. Music, writing, acting, production value hysterically awful. Can't believe Hugh Grant was ever this bad.

This is a great DVD featuring Hugh Grant.  Very
enjoyable story about a affluent young man who's travels bring him
to the scene of many historical events in Europe and the
USA in his endeavors to sell his champagne.  He constantly
struggles for ownership of the champagne land with his
uncle.
This film should be titled, "Cheap Wine Charlie." Poorly done at all levels. One star out of sympathy for the actors!

Megan Follows was great in this movie. I thought she was so sweet being
the teen girl who was in love with the boy who she known for years. But he didn't know how he felt about her intell later in the movie. This movie
is a great love story to see and you have to see.
This is a great little known Hugh Grant Movie about a man trying to open up the champagn market just prior the Civil War. It should be released on DVD at a more affordable price!!!!!!1
